reviewText: Nice production visually. Almost all the songs are lipsynced on this DVD. Some distastefully obvious. Britney performs her best striptease dance routines and displays enough cleavage for everyone.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Britney's form is pleasing to the eye and she can get her groove on.  The girl can dance.  However, I'm curious to see if she can sing *and* dance at the same time.This show's got it all- bursts of fire, cascades of waterfalls, glitter, bubbles, a big giant music box.  In the end, this wasn't really a concert.  It was a show, a spectacle.I actually enjoyed watching it, but it was more about the choreography, the dancing, and the eye popping effects than anything the music.  If you like Britney or just like her style of performing and want to watch an upbeat show of dancing, wild costumes, and lots of sparkly extras, then get this 'concert.'However, in some instances it's just painfully obvious that she's lipsynching.But, the girl has stage presence.  If you can take it as just a show and not so much a concert, then this might be what you're looking for.  It's good for entertainment, but not so much for real musical appreciation.  If you expect something along the lines of Madonna or Sarah Brightman-esque authenticity in concerts, you may want to pass Britney up.Hope it helps :)
summary: More a show than a concert
Title: N/A

reviewText: Yes, pop star Britney Spears has another DVD out this year. Besides past "Live and More", "Britney The Videos" and "Time out with...". This one takes the taco. Britney performs her "Dream Within A Dream" 2001 tour LIVE at the MGM Grand Garden Arena - November 2001. The MGM has seen its share of great artists. Barbra Streisand held her Millennium Concert there.This concert is spectacular for all Spears fans. The choreography, the back-up track, the special effects, and the whole thing. Britney performes hits from her 3 albums "...Baby One More Time", "Oops!...I Did It Again", and "Britney". Britney has never disapointed me, and for that, she has millions of fans. Recently her little mishap in the UK didn't help for her persona, but, who can blame her. I'd be the same way!"OOPS!...I DID IT AGAIN"This number opens the concert. It is naturally lip-sunc, but if you listen closely you can hear Britney sing a little. It's a great start."(YOU DRIVE ME) CRAZY"Remixed. Britney usually opens with this number. She tackles this one with tuns of dance moves and all pure Britney."OVERPROTECTED"The newest single for the USA. This is performed as the album version. This is my favorite track off of the "Britney" album."MEDLEY:"a) Born To Make You Happyb) Luckyc) SometimesThis Medley basically gets rid of the "...Baby One More Time" and "Oops!...I Did It Again" album hits. It's nice to have a Britney medley!"BOYS"This is a FUNKY song. It's a R&B-type; dance track. Britney is very sexy."STRONGER"One of my most favorite songs. The dancing is increadible!"I'M NOT A GIRL, NOT YET A WOMAN"Britney sang A LITTLE BIT on this track. It's very beautiful."I LOVE ROCK 'N' ROLL"This is more fast than the album version. It's funky."WHAT IT'S LIKE TO BE ME"The Britney-Justin song, since they recently broke up I'm sure she's not very thrilled about it. I like what it has to say."LONELY"This track or "Boys" is bound to be a single off of the album."DON'T LET ME BE THE LAST TO KNOW"My absolute favorite Britney song. I wish she would have performed it because she can perform the hell out of it!"ANTICIPATING"A Disco-type track. It's in a CRAYOLA type of background."I'M A SLAVE 4 U" (Encore)Very sexy and better than the album version. It's like the MTV Music Awards 2001."...BABY ONE MORE TIME" (Encore)This BIG-WET encore. A nice end to the show!For the retards out there that think Britney won't be around for a long time...THINK AGAIN. She'll always be around. I LOVE YOU BRITNEY!

reviewText: Out of all Britney's videos, this really takes the biscuit. A full 90-minute performance of 15 of Britney's biggest hits at MGM Grand in Las Vegas on Sunday 18th November 2001 for HBO as a promotional concert for her third album, Britney. Although the concert is superb, there was no need because the album sold 745,000 copies in its first week of release, went straight to No.1 in the US becoming her third consecutive No.1 US album and has sold 17 million copies worldwide to date. Britney performs hits such as Oops!...I Did It Again, (You Drive Me) Crazy, Sometimes, Lucky, Born To Make You Happy, I'm A Slave 4 U, Don't Let Me Be The Last To Know, Overprotected, Stronger, I'm Not A Girl, Not Yet A Woman, Baby One More Time, her new single for Europe I Love Rock 'N' Roll and the amazing Boys.  You'll see Britney perform under a real waterfall to Baby One More Time, dance around 50ft above the stage on a platform to I Love Rock 'N' Roll, set fireworks off from her dancers' costumes and wear no less than 10 different costumes!An hour of this was shown on New Years' Day 2002 in the UK - but this video includes unseen on TV performances of Don't Let Me Be The Last To Know, Anticipating, What It's Like To Be Me, Lonely, a enjoyable and entertaining VH1 "Behind The Music" skit, a special Spoken Word with Britney in which Britney interacts with the audience and tells them how proud she is of her country since September 11th and tons of other stuff to indulge in! She also sets the record straight about how she has to deal with continual criticism from people who have no idea what they're talking about. Britney's management spent millions on sets and lighting to make this concert truly one in a million. The stage sets and dancing arrangements/sequences are splendid and expertly done. Britney's dancers also get a chance to shine as they breakdown to the beat and dance their butts off! This concert really proves how creative and imaginative Britney Spears really is. OK, she lip-syncs through most of the songs. But that's only because of the up-beat dance routines that she has to perform as well. A lot of singers lip-sync, but Britney seems to get the most flack for it and she shouldn't because she is a very talented and attractive woman - one in a million! By the end of the concert, you are left mesmerized, entranced and awe-struck by Britney - especially the final performance of Baby One More Time. A soaking wet Britney Spears with a minature top and tight blue jeans is enough to turn ANY red-blooded male into jelly!This is a must for any Britney fan! Along with Madonna's Drowned World Tour, Britney's Dream Within A Dream Tour is one of the greatest concerts of 2001! This concert really proves what a talented performer Britney Spears really is. Let's hope that Britney concerts are as good as this in the future...
summary: Live In Las Vegas is an extremely entertaining concert! ! !

reviewText: I bought this DVD because I thought that in a concert which was in Las Vegas, Britney would have sang some of the songs, but...She doesn't sing any of the 16 songs, except "Don't Let Me Be The Last To Know", that's the only song she sings in the whole concert, but the concert itself is great!The stage where she "performs" is awesome, with fireworks, bunji flights, a "flying stage" in some songs, and the most amazing of all is the rain in the stage (of coure the people don't ger wet) in Baby One More Time. There's something else I have to object: the DVD does not include any special featurette!In other countries, the DVD includes 3 music videos (I'm A Slave 4 U, Overprotected and I'm Not A Girl, Not Yet A Woman) and the Crossroads movie trailer. The DVD is great, and the new versions for some of the songs are awesome, the only one bad thing is that she doesn't sing almost any of the songs.TRACKLISTING:IntroOops! I Did It Again(You Drive Me) CrazyOverprotectedInterludeMEDLEY: Born To Make You Happy, Lucky, SometimesBoysStongerInterludeI'm Not A Girl, Not Yet A WomanInterludeI Love Rock 'N' RollInterludeWhat It's Like To Be MeLonelyDon't Let Me Be The Last To KnowInterludeAnticipatingI'm A Slave 4 UOutro...Baby One More Time (Remix)

reviewText: In the late fall of 2001, Britney embarked on her third tour, The Dream Within A Dream Tour 2001-2002. I did see Britney on this tour twice: The first being on December 10th, 2001 and the second being June 28th, 2002. Both were here in South Philly. But this VHS and DVD televised concert was aired live on HBO when Britney performed at the GRAND MGM ARENA in Las Vegas on November 21, 2001.The show starts off with one of Britney's female dancers walking towards centerstage, wearing a short pink & white nightgown, carrying a lantern, while dungeon sounds are played. The dancer makes it to centerstage and says, Is It All That I See Or Seem But A Dream Within A Dream? She then descends to the bottom of the stage, as two large flames shoot up on the sides, as horrifying music is set off. On the back-drop screen, a golden pixie flies across it and makes it to the front and says, Have You Ever Had A Dream That Felt So Real That You Could Not Tell The Difference Between The Real World And The Dream World? He flies away, to reveal a peaceful paradise picture. He comes back and says, Which World Are You In Now? The screen then reveals a bunch of people telling their dreams until Britney floats by in a bubble, which zooms out into a video of Britney saying, Last Night I Dreamt Of This Very Moment When I Was Here With All Of You... And Now My Dream's Come True. The picture cuts off as a hard version of OOPS!... I DID IT AGAIN STARTS. Britney takes the stage, wearing a long-sleeved black half-top, black tasseled pants (an outfit similar to the outfit she wore in the dance sequences of the Stronger music video), complete with a long black Cape Coat, while chained to a huge platform, as she performed OOPS!... I DID IT AGAIN. No, she wasn't chained to the platform during the whole song, she came off of it when she started the second verse. She finishes up OOPS!... I DID IT AGAIN by saying, Ooh, I did it again! She falls backward, takes off the jacket and performs (YOU DRIVE ME) CRAZY.After (YOU DRIVE ME) CRAZY, she went for a costume change. Britney came out, wearing a brown/gold jumpsuit, to perform OVERPROTECTED. After OVERPROTECTED, Britney went back for another costume change. Jon Voight took the stage. He tells a story of a ballerina princess who was locked in her jewelry box until her true love set her free. After Jon Voight finished, a large jewelry box was wheeled out to centerstage. The band started playing a ballerina version of BORN TO MAKE YOU HAPPY. Britney came out of the box, elevating on a pedestal, wearing a white tank-top with rhinestones and a too-too. She sang the first verse and first chorus of BORN TO MAKE YOU HAPPY, until she started descending back into the box. Before she could disappear into the box, the front of it opened up. She takes off the too-too, puts on a movie-star-Marilyn-Monroe like coat, where the interior is the American Flag, to perform LUCKY. She started with the section where she says ISN'T SHE LOVELY THIS HOLLYWOOD GIRL? AND THEY SAY. She then sings the chorus, which leads into the bridge of the song. She then starts off with the first verse, second chorus, and bridge of SOMETIMES, with a thin white dress coat. She gets back into her box and is wheeled away as Jon Voight finishes the story.After the medley, Britney comes back out, wearing, a black tank-top, grey dress slacks, complete with suspenders, to perform BOYS. After BOYS, Britney grabbed a long black coat and hat, where both had pink and green paint splattered on it, to perform STRONGER. She finished up STRONGER, took off the hat and coat, and sat down next to her piano player, who was sitting centerstage, playing a nice little piece. Britney sits down and has a chat with her audience, which leads into a beautiful performance of I'M NOT A GIRL, NOT YET A WOMAN.She finishes I'M NOT A GIRL, NOT YET A WOMAN, as the back-drop screen shows Britney and her female dancers putting together a Janis Joplin wannabe band. They pen different old songs to cover, but can't find the right one until they come across I LOVE ROCK 'N ROLL. Britney then takes the stage, dressed in a purple jacket, blue shirt, and green jeans, to perform I LOVE ROCK 'N ROLL. She and her dancers are on this platform which elevates into the air. She comes down to the stage and performs WHAT'S IT LIKE TO BE ME. After performing WHAT IT'S LIKE TO BE ME, she comes across a huge back-drop screen and has a battle with a video alter ego version of herself as she vamps through LONELY.After LONELY, Britney took the stage, wearing a white, sparkling gown, to perform DON'T LET ME BE THE LAST TO KNOW. She takes another costume change after DON'T LET ME BE THE LAST TO KNOW. She comes back out as her and all her female dancers are dressed in Barbie-like outfits, to perform ANTICIPATING. After ANTICIPATING, she took off her Barbie outfit to reveal short tight green bikini top, yellow shorts, and green boots, to perform a jungle version of I'M A SLAVE 4 U. She finishes up I'M A SLAVE 4 U and says her good-byes. But she comes back out for one encore: ...BABY ONE MORE TIME, but I won?t let that one out. Below is the tour's setlist.OOPS!...I DID IT AGAIN(YOU DRIVE ME) CRAZYOVERPROTECTED(Medley) BORN TO MAKE YOU HAPPY/LUCKY/SOMETIMESBOYSSTRONGERI'M NOT A GIRL, NOT YET A WOMANI LOVE ROCK 'N' ROLLWHAT IT'S LIKE TO BE MELONELYDON'T LET ME BE THE LAST TO KNOWANTICIPATINGI'M A SLAVE 4 U...BABY ONE MORE TIME
summary: Live From Las Vegas: The Dream Within A Dream Tour 2001-2002

reviewText: I had mixed feelings after viewing Britney Spears' Live from Las Vegas! HBO concert special.  First off, there was hardly any amazing choreography for this show, something that Spears usually has a plethora of.  Second, her rendition of her ballady single "Don't Let Me Be the Last to Know" sounded a little too deep, low, and Toni Braxton-like for my liking (let alone unnatural for Britney - did the microphone not process her voice right?).  Third of all, the effects --though amazing in scale-- could confuse as easily as the questioning over Britney's "assetts."  Britney's touching tribute to our nation's armed forces did add a tish of realness to the typically-fabricated Miss Spears.  Overall, a good but not amazing show.
summary: Not as good as expected but ok

reviewText: For all of the praise and acclaim that Britney Spears receives from the media and from fans worldwide (what they see in her, I still don't know), there isn't much Spears has done to justify it - basically she comes off to me as someone that got by on pure luck rather than talent. She can't sing a note in tune, her dancing is substandard, the songs are accompanied by cheesy outdated sequencers, and the lyrics are nothing short of abominable - and this DVD proves it.  If the vocals have a pre-recorded sound to them, that's because they WERE pre-recorded - Spears is lip-synching throughout the whole "live" performance!I'm sure Spears is aware of her many shortcomings - she hopes to distract everyone from them by wearing as little clothing as possible, including plenty of gratuitous cleavage shots (A note to parents: Keep this in mind when one of your children asks for this DVD). If there's anything I'll give her credit for, she sets a record for the amount of outfit changes she goes through during her performance - and that's about all I'll give her credit for. This DVD is all the proof you need that she is a lip-synching flunky and an average dancer at best - the only thing she's got going for her is her sex appeal, but that shouldn't translate to a successful career in the music industry.In summary: This DVD is not worth your time or money. Spears can't decide whether she wants to appeal to children (through her cheesy bubblegum pop songs) or teenage boys and unmarried middle-aged men (through her revealing outfits), and comes up with something that's a complete waste of time, totally lacking purpose or substance. Basically, combine Teletubbies with a movie like "Showgirls", and you have Britney Spears: Live From Las Vegas in a nutshell - a concept that is as ridiculous as it is pointless.

reviewText: We all know Britney can dance. We all know Britney can make excellent videos, and we all know she can't sing that well live, but it does not matter because the one thing Britney can do is put on an incredible show. Britneys at her best on her Dream Within a Dream Live From Vegas tour. From the opening Oops...I Did It Again she will have you hooked as she performs each and everyone of her hits. The choreography, staging, costumes, and special affects are breathtaking. I do widh she would sing live, but then a part of me doesn't. Its not about what she sounds like or even the songs themselves, its the perfect performance of them that matters. She is an entertainer and she soars at entertaining. Highlights include the funky Boys, Overprotected, and What Its Like To Be Me, The finale of Baby One More Time is the most sexually charged performance with Britney getting drenched as rain pours down on the stage. If anyone has not seen Britney live than you all must, but this concert will do just fine for the time being.

reviewText: Britney Spears' "Live from Las Vegas" is a true spectacle. Yes, Britney wows the audience with her dancing, special effects, and filmed sequences, but these are all things I've seen before in many, many shows. Britney does serve her purpose for going out there and putting on a big show, but hearing the backing tracks that play on her CDs in the background and her lipsynching is not very interesting. After a while you get tired of it. Then comes the ballad and Britney tries her hardest to make the audience believe that she is a real singer, but it comes off very forced and almost painful (I'm going by her facial expressions as she sings). I'm not trying to bash Britney Spears, but writhing around on the floor soaking wet is not my idea of a great show - we've seen all of this before from her and others, so it's nothing new and exciting. Like another reviewer stated, "She has a lot to learn."
summary: It's Alright, but I Wasn't Impressed

reviewText: I liked this concert of Britney Spears better than the one-hour special she did on FOX.  It was a big, massive production, loads of lights and a lot of dancing and choreography! She did a lot of costume changes. She did a lot of songs from her three albums.  The show starts off with a dream, then builds up in momentum.  Spears does lip-sync on a few songs, but I happened to hear her band more than the record she was lip-synching over.  That concert proved that Britney is a dynamic performer and entertainer.  I hope they make a concert DVD of the Onyx Hotel tour that she did in the spring of this year. The Las Vegas element is why this concert is full of the excess and the big lights circling and swinging all across that stage.

reviewText: This DVD features Britney Spears at an appearance at the MGM Grand in Las Vegas in 2001, during her Dream Within A Dream Tour.  Although Ms. Spears appears to be lip synching throughout much of the show, she and her crew of dancers deliver an energetic and exciting performance featuring most of her well known hits at the time.  Originally broadcast live on HBO, Britney wows the crowd in this 90 minute Emmy winning production.A pop sensation since her debut in 1999, Britney Spears' meteoric rise in popularity has been built on more than just her talents as a singer, as her looks, dancing ability, and her evolving persona, have been incorporated into her music.  Spears is a talented dancer, and a fine stage performer in general, who seems to have grown up really fast from schoolgirl to sex symbol.  Befitting the huge venue at the MGM Grand, this show is about going big and making a huge splash, with a group of dancers supporting Spears in what are mostly energetic production numbers with impressive lighting and stage accoutrements.  A live broadcast with much at stake, made actually singing during these physically demanding dance routines impractical, so Spears lip synchs through almost the entire performance.  Even so she's hardly slacking off, "singing" and dancing through some complicated production numbers.  Judged by the audience's reaction, the popularity of the HBO broadcast, and DVD sales, her fans apparently have no major problems with Britney's performance.This well staged production allows the energy level to rise and fall, and the mood to shift.  The stage at the MGM's Grand Garden Court is unique, and the performance makes good use of the unusually shaped stage, which has a long runway, and also features various trapdoors.  This is Vegas after all, and the show has all the glitz, glamour, and sex appeal, you might expect.By the third song "Overprotected" Britney has hit her stride, performing in a circle of green lasers.  While Jon Voight provides an introduction, Britney makes her first costume change for "Born To Make You Happy" and "Sometimes", two of her less frenetic numbers.It's time to get nasty, as the ensemble rocks through "Boys" and the fireworks explode on "Stronger" as Britney takes command of the stage by herself, before being joined by her troupe of Cirqueish male dancers.  The native of Louisiana engages with the audience, and pays her respects to the US military, before proceeding to "I'm Not A Girl, Not Yet A Woman", one of the few soft moments in the show.Britney and her female dancers perform a rousing version of "I Love Rock `N' Roll" on a suspended platform.  The stage band gets to play for a while, as Britney and the dancers prep for the show's final numbers.  Britney emerges dressed in a white gown to perform "Don't Let Me Be The Last To Know" on a raised circular stand, with smoke billowing from the bottom.  Performed to a dollhouse theme, the bouncy "Anticipating" is a little girl's fantasy gone wild, as Britney continues to keep the audience involved and engaged.  But Britney being Britney, she can't stay a good little girl for very long, and she proceeds into an extremely provocative rendition of "I'm A Slave 4 U".The show closes with an encore, a spectacular and wet version of "Baby One More Time" which opens with water sprinkling down on the stage, as a hologram of Spears appears in the falling water.  Rocking again on that suspended platform, Britney and her dancers are soaked to the skin.  Closing the show in a boldly unique, and sexy fashion.If you want to see Britney Spears in a glitzy musical extravaganza with lots of energetic dancing and edgy choreography, to the tune of prerecorded music, this is definitely the show for you.  While not a vocal performance in a true concert setting, Britney Spears works her butt off to entertain.  While perhaps intended equally for the eyes as well as the ears, if you are a Spears fan, that may not matter very much to you.  Unfortunately the DVD contains little in the way of extras, and it's disappointing that Britney never appears in the white glittered Elvis inspired jumpsuit, that is featured on the faade of the MGM Grand, and the DVD cover.
summary: not much live singing, but Britney puts on a damn fine show...
Title: N/A

reviewText: I know im going to get dissed majorly for this, but I don't care!! My friends and I decided to watch this when It first came out on HBO... I totally didn't get it?!?! why did she have to lip synch every single damn song... that got so annoying...  Iknow it's harder for her to sing since she dances, but I know alot of people who can dance and sing at the same time!  And what's this whole thing about trying to make a "Young britney and sexy britney"?? she is such a contradiction!! Not to mention the in-between-song skits... like the hippy section... what the heck was that all about?  I admit I do like some of britneys songs and it seems she does have a good personality, but this concert is not one of her best... I had to stop it before the end of the concert... cuz I was getting a britney headache.... MY TWO CENTS.. You may now attack....
